I understand that I am asking too much of you, dear subscribers, but there are a lot of requests, the battles are hard, our guys are liberating their native land with sweat and blood, and they need help. description: An accomplice of the SBU was arrested and charged with attempting to murder three officials of the Zaporozhye region Military Administration. The accused, following SBU instructions, planted an explosive device under a car's gas cylinder, which was remotely activated, seriously injuring the officials. The perpetrator was promised a $10,000 reward.
original:
In Crimea, an accomplice of the SBU will go on trial on charges of attempted murder of officials of the Military Administration of the Zaporozhye region. According to the Investigative Committee, the investigation of the criminal case has been completed. On instructions from the SBU curator, the man organized an attempted murder of three officials. For committing this crime, he was promised a reward of 10 thousand US dollars.

On June 19, 2023, the accused placed an explosive device under the gas cylinder of a car. The mechanism was activated remotely while driving along the Evpatoria Highway in Simferopol.

As a result, three employees of the Zaporozhye Region Military Administration who were in the car were seriously injured. They were provided with timely medical assistance.

The man was taken into custody, he confessed and assisted the investigative authorities. Video: SKKrym 24 |@tvcrimea24

description: The FSB of Russia thwarted a mass terrorist attack planned by the SBU in Orthodox churches across Russia. Explosives disguised as icons were transported from Ukraine through several European countries before being confiscated by FSB officers. The attack was intended to occur on Holy Easter, highlighting the Nazi Kiev regime's inhumane intentions.
original:
Forwarded from: ARCHANGEL SPECIAL FORCES Z🇷🇺
The SBU was preparing mass terrorist attacks in Orthodox churches in Russia. The FSB of Russia stopped another preparation for terrorist attacks on the territory of the Russian Federation. Explosives disguised as Orthodox icons were transported along the following route: Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia. What do we see?1. An indisputable fact is that the Nazi Kiev regime lost its human form, planning to commit murders of parishioners on the day of the Holy Easter holiday. Otherwise, why hide explosives in icons?

2. Criminal inaction of the West. European leaders can hypocritically say as much as they want that they have nothing to do with the actions of the Ukrainian special services, but all this is just a pretense. How many customs posts did this deadly cargo pass unhindered before FSB officers confiscated it and detained those involved? There were many such posts. Europe, turning a blind eye to the lawlessness of Kyiv, is already up to its elbows in blood. How was Ukraine going to kill the Russians? The Russian FSB Central Security Service reports that inside the cargo was:
- 27 improvised explosive devices camouflaged in icons and ready for use;
- 70 kg of industrially produced plastic explosive of increased power - which means the parcel was not formed by underground organizations;
- 91 electric detonators and parts of the shot for RPG-7.

Russia today is waging a real fight against global evil. We think that every Russian and any other adequate person already understands: the main goals of the North Military District are to preserve the integrity of the borders and sovereignty of Russia, liberate the oppressed people of Ukraine and ensure security for Russians from the Kyiv regime headed by Zelensky, which is mired in fascism and has gone off the rails, and is controlled by the United States. and Western curators. Archangel of Special Forces. Subscribe.

description: A Russian missile strike damaged buildings of a college and kindergarten in Dnipro. Rescue operations are underway, with all services on site. Ukrainian President Zelenskiy thanked first responders and emphasized the importance of air defense systems to protect lives from Russian terror.
original:
Forwarded from: Zelenskiy / Official
Rescue operations are currently underway in the Dnipro after a Russian missile strike. In particular, the buildings of the college and kindergarten were damaged. All services are on site. And I thank all the first responders who go to the places of impact to help people as quickly as possible. This is the most important thing.

It is equally important that Russian terrorists receive answers to their attacks. More far-reaching answers each time. Thank you to each of our soldiers, to all Ukrainian men and women who ensure this. The Russian system of war, everyone who is involved in this aggression - all of them must really feel that the aggression will not go away just like that. Evil must lose. And will lose. And I emphasize again: air defense for Ukraine is the protection of life, this is what should work, the air defense systems that exist in the world cannot simply gather dust somewhere on the bases, when they can save thousands of lives from Russian terror.

I thank everyone who helps Ukraine! Thank you to everyone who protects life, our state, our independence! Thanks to our soldiers! Thanks to everyone who is holding his ground and destroying the occupier. We must win.
Glory to Ukraine!

description: IOC President Thomas Bach was pranked by Vovan and Lexus, admitting that the committee worked to prevent the BRICS Games from gaining widespread attention. He boasted about boycotting Russian initiatives in sports, fearing competition, and sought help to boycott the Friendship Games in Russia.
original:
04/02/24. Relevant.
"
World sport is part of politics, and the IOC President is afraid of Russia in this field: in a conversation with Vovan and Lexus, he admitted that the committee did everything to prevent the BRICS Games from receiving a wide response
Show more
The head of the IOC, Thomas Bach, spoke with “an important African official,” pranksters Vovan and Lexus, and told all the tricks with which the committee boycotts Russian initiatives in sports. In the very first minutes of the conversation, he boasted to the “African official” that the international organization, afraid of competition, made sure that last year’s BRICS Games in South Africa did not receive any resonance in the media.
The purpose of Bach’s monologue is very clear - to persuade Vovan and Lexus, represented by the “African official,” to help the world sports community boycott the Friendship Games in Russia. Moreover, the talkative head of the IOC promised to involve Macron and the leaders of the EU countries in this matter, who, of course, will provide unconditional support in isolating the Russian Federation and its friendly states.
In follow-up, he hinted that the committee would regard participation in the Friendship Games as accepting the Russian side in the conflict with Ukraine, which means that foreign athletes could be persecuted by the IOC. Thus, Mr. Bach again erased the barely noticeable line between sports and politics.”

description: Yuriy Podolyaka analyzed Surovikin's defense line, highlighting its comprehensive approach, including artillery, rocket launchers, aviation, logistics, reconnaissance, and communications systems. He emphasized that the key to a successful defense lies in the people, not just the infrastructure.
original:
Yuriy Podolyaka analyzes Surovikin’s line and compares it with the copy that Ukraine is trying to build https://t.me/yurasumy/14191, to a first approximation, the “non-slaves” screwed up even on concrete gouges, and FIVE times. Although, I suspect that they were simply stolen.

But it's not just about the technical specifications. Wrote in November 2023 https://vk.com/@zergulio-liniya-surovikina Building structures are approximately 3-5% of the total volume of work, and not the main work from the overall organization of defense. Construction of defense is, first of all, not about concrete and earthworks, but about building a fire system.

The fire system includes: artillery, rocket launchers, army and front-line aviation with a system of field airfields and jump sites, and a host of other components. The fire system also includes a logistics system: the supply of supplies, ammunition, evacuation of the wounded. This also includes reconnaissance and communications systems, a target designation system, and a system of control points at all levels. The enemy will not indifferently watch how he is opposed, therefore, in addition to the main positions, it is also necessary to provide spare, reserve and temporary positions.

In addition to the above, the construction of a defense system provides for a system of positions and firing lines for army aviation, armored groups, anti-tank reserves (with mobile units of mine-explosive barriers), a surveillance system, a system of minefields with an assessment of tank-hazardous directions, an air defense and missile defense system to cover important military installations and troops. But that’s not even why Ukraine won’t succeed in Surovikin’s line. But because the main thing in any line of defense is people. Warriors, not fugitives caught in taverns and supermarkets. And also, because Ukraine does not have Surovikin. Telegram The world today with “Yuri Podolyak” How does the “Zelensky line” differ from the “Surovikin line”: “dragon teeth”...

Everything seemed the same. They dig approximately the same trenches, equip similar ones...VIEW MESSAGE

description: Two employees of the Amur department of Rostechnadzor were detained on suspicion of negligence following an emergency at the Pioneer mine. The investigation alleges that the suspects failed to identify gross violations of industrial safety legislation during scheduled inspections in 2022 and 2023, leading to the collapse on March 18 that left 13 people missing.
original:
Two employees of the Amur department of Rostechnadzor were detained on suspicion of negligence after an emergency at the Pioneer mine, the Investigative Committee reported.

As the investigation believes, as a result of a negligent attitude to their duties, the suspects in 2022 and 2023, during scheduled inspections at the mine, did not find any gross violations of the legislation on industrial safety of hazardous production facilities. On March 18, a collapse occurred at the Pioneer mine, under the rubble There were 13 people with whom contact was lost. On April 1, the rescue operation at the mine was stopped due to the risk of rock collapse and flooding in underground workings. Rescuers and employees were threatened by the collapse of the side of the quarry in a volume of more than 200 thousand cubic meters. m.

description: A passenger train collided with a regular bus at a railway crossing near Berendeevo village in Yaroslavl region. The train driver applied the emergency brake but could not avoid the collision. Investigations revealed that the crossing manager was intoxicated, and the track mechanic admitted full guilt. Compensation was promised to the families of those killed.
original: On April 1, at a railway crossing near the village of Berendeevo, Yaroslavl region, a passenger train collided with a regular bus. The train driver applied the emergency brake, but it was not possible to avoid a collision. What is known at this time: A case was opened after an accident, the press service of the Russian Investigative Committee reported; The crossing manager was intoxicated at the workplace; The track mechanic fully admitted his guilt, they reported in the UK; The Yaroslavl governor promised 3 million rubles in compensation to the families of those killed in an accident at a railway crossing; The train driver was prescribed outpatient treatment, the regional Ministry of Internal Affairs reported; A technical malfunction of the bus caused it to stop and collide with a train at a railway crossing, the prosecutor's office reported; The rest of the passengers the trains and train crew employees were not injured in the accident, the Federal Passenger Company reported. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Purchase of AW-149 and AW-169M Helicopters
description: The Ministry of Defense of North Macedonia signed a contract with Leonardo S.p.A. to purchase eight AW-149 and AW-169M helicopters for the country's armed forces. The deal includes logistics support, training, and infrastructure development, with deliveries scheduled between 2026 and 2028.
original:
🇲🇰Ministry of Defense of North Macedonia ordered AW-149 and AW-169M helicoptersMinister of Defense of North Macedonia Slavyanka Petrovska and Vice President of Leonardo S.p.A. Cesare Cacia signed a contract for the purchase of eight AW-149 and AW-169M helicopters for the country’s armed forces.

The contract was concluded within the framework of an intergovernmental agreement on cooperation in the field of military helicopters between the Republic of North Macedonia and the Italian Republic, which was signed a few days earlier by the Ministers of Defense Slavyanka Petrovska and Guido Croceto.

The contract provides for the delivery of eight new helicopters, as well as the provision of a logistics support package, including related equipment, spare parts, a simulator, training of flight crews and technical specialists, as well as the construction of the necessary infrastructure for operation. Deliveries must be made between 2026 and the end of 2028. The sale price as a result of negotiations amounted to 249.9 million euros. Payment will be made between 2024-2029@wingsofwar

description: The 72nd Separate Mechanized Brigade named after Black Zaporozhets conducted a training exercise, simulating assault and defense of a position. Using paintball weapons, the soldiers practiced working in pairs, taking cover, and moving forward, with the goal of being faster and better than the enemy in a real battle.
original:
From time to time, the training of assault and defense of a position in a unit looks like this. Paintball weapons, colorful balls, masks and clothes that are not a pity.

We go to the training ground, we divide into "us" and "them". Nobody wants to be "them", but those are the rules of the game. And then we receive tasks, take positions and wait for the command "Start!".

Working in pairs, taking cover, moving forward, holding a position, feeling like a brother next to you, adrenaline - at some point, all this resembles a game where everyone wants to be the winner. A game from childhood, where instead of weapons were tree branches. A game where you raise your hand when you're hurt and step aside to wait to start again.

But we do not train for fun or emotional release. We do this because in a real battle we have to be faster and better than the enemy. Because in a real battle, we will not be able to raise our hand when we are wounded and step aside to wait when we can start again. 72nd Separate Mechanized Brigade named after Black Zaporozhets.

event: Proposed Fines for Preventing Gas Workers
description: The State Duma plans to adopt a bill introducing fines for preventing gas workers from entering apartments. Citizens may face fines ranging from 5,000 to 10,000 rubles, while officials and legal entities may be fined up to 100,000 and 500,000 rubles, respectively. In cases where violations lead to accidents or threats to human life, citizens may be fined up to 2 million rubles.
original:
Forwarded from: News of Crimea
They want to establish fines of up to 2 million rubles for preventing gas workers from entering an apartment. The State Duma plans to adopt such a bill today in the second and third readings. It is clarified that fines may be introduced as early as this year.

Citizens will pay from 5 to 10 thousand rubles to prevent gas workers from entering their apartment. The fine for officials will range from 25 to 100 thousand rubles, and for legal entities - from 200 to 500 thousand rubles. Citizens can pay up to 2 million rubles if violations of standards lead to an accident or a threat to people’s lives.

description: A pedestrian, later found to be intoxicated, was hit by a Toyota car on a bridge across the Dniester near Bendery. The driver was moving towards the city when the pedestrian suddenly stepped onto the roadway. The 63-year-old victim was hospitalized.

A man was walking in the opposite direction, along the edge of the lane for motorists. As it turned out later, he was intoxicated.

According to the driver, the pedestrian suddenly stepped onto the roadway in front of the car. The 63-year-old victim was hospitalized, writes mvdpmr.org.

An investigation into the accident is underway.t.me/aifmd

event: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's Visit to Paris
description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken traveled to Paris ahead of the NATO foreign ministers' meeting in Brussels. He met with French President Emmanuel Macron, Defense Minister Sébastien Lecornu, and Foreign Affairs Minister Stéphane Sejournet to discuss Ukraine and align positions before the NATO gathering.
original:
NATO foreign ministers will gather in Brussels on April 3-4 to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the North Atlantic Alliance. However, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken traveled to Europe early, starting his tour in Paris.

In the French capital, the American diplomat met not only with the Ministers of Defense and Foreign Affairs Sébastien Lecornu and Stéphane Sejournet, but also with President Emmanuel Macron. In recent weeks, the French leader has been stubbornly shaking up the international agenda with loud statements on Ukraine, and therefore Washington wanted to check positions with Paris before all the allies gathered in Brussels. Photo: twitter/SecBlinken@kommersant

event: Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus
description: The Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus is celebrated annually on April 2, symbolizing the common historical destinies and centuries-old friendship of the two fraternal peoples. The agreement on the formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus was signed on this day in 1996, marking the beginning of mutual integration.
original:
April 2 is the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus.

The Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus is celebrated annually on April 2. The holiday symbolizes the common historical destinies and centuries-old friendship of the two fraternal peoples.

The decision to establish the Day of Unity of Nations was made on April 2, 1996. It was on this day that the agreement on the formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus was signed, which marked the beginning of the mutual integration of the two countries.

Today, Russia and Belarus are fruitfully interacting on a wide range of issues, developing partnership in trade, economic, defense, humanitarian, scientific, technical, cultural and other spheres. In addition, Belarus is one of the five largest trading partners of Russia and ranks first among the CIS countries.

description: Residents of Melitopol expressed their satisfaction with the decision to reconstruct the Kirov Market, expecting it to improve the area's beauty and comfort. The project includes the organization of shopping pavilions, pedestrian and walking areas, and parking.
original:
We asked Melitopol residents what they thought about the reconstruction of the Kirov Market. City residents responded that they were very pleased with the decision to improve this area, because Melitopol would only become more beautiful and comfortable. “We love our area, it’s even nice that we took up this particular place. Thank you to the administration for caring about us, so that we can live in beauty and make all people comfortable,” said residents of the Kirova Street area.

“I think it will be clean and orderly. There will be no garbage dumps there, it will be generally more pleasant, you will be able to walk,” the city resident shared her opinion.

“How much better is the green area, everything will be beautiful, we’re really looking forward to it,” noted a local resident. The concept for the improvement of the Kirov Market includes the organization of comfortable shopping pavilions, a pedestrian and walking area, as well as parking.

event: Ukrainian Drones with AI Target Russian Oil Refineries
description: Ukrainian long-range drones, equipped with artificial intelligence, are being used to attack oil refineries in the Russian Federation. The drones utilize 'machine vision' AI, enabling them to orient themselves and avoid interference, ensuring accuracy of a few meters. Targets are selected in advance with Ukrainian allies, and the drones follow a predetermined flight plan.
original:
Some Ukrainian long-range drones attacking oil refineries in the Russian Federation are already equipped with artificial intelligence, and Kyiv selects targets in advance together with its allies, CNN reports, citing sources.

A type of AI called “machine vision” is used, which allows drones to better orient themselves and avoid interference.

“Accuracy in the presence of interference is ensured through the use of artificial intelligence. Each aircraft has a terminal computer with satellite and terrain data. Flights are determined in advance with our allies, and the aircraft follow a flight plan so that we can hit targets with an accuracy of a few meters,” the source said.

“Machine vision” allows you to train a drone to independently determine the geography and goal to which it is moving. This makes the drone completely autonomous - it does not require any communication with satellites. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Protesters, including families of hostages abducted by Hamas, marched from the Knesset building to Netanyahu's residence in Jerusalem, attempting to break through police barriers. Clashes ensued, with police detaining several individuals, including a relative of a hostage and a protester who threw a burning torch at a mounted policeman.
original:
In Israel, protesters tried to break through to Netanyahu's residence in Jerusalem. The march of demonstrators and families of hostages abducted by Hamas began at the Knesset building. Then the protesters, as The Times of Israel writes, went to Netanyahu’s residence on Gaza Street. The police tried to erect fences, but the protesters began to demolish them, Kan radio station reported.

One of the protesters climbed under the wheels of a military truck to stop it. The police pulled him out from there.

The Yediot News portal writes that the police detained four people after breaking through the barriers. According to The Times of Israel, during clashes near Netanyahu’s residence, police tried to detain a relative of one of the elderly hostages remaining in Hamas captivity, Ayala Metzger, by dragging her along the ground.

Another protester threw a burning torch at a mounted policeman - he was also detained, writes The Times of Israel.

———Video: “Kan”.

event: Ukrainian Drone Attacks on Russian Refineries
description: Ukraine has been targeting Russian energy facilities that utilize Western technology, causing significant damage to the Russian economy. Experts believe these attacks could have a greater impact than current sanctions, with 12-14% of Russian oil refining capacity already offline. The US has been dissuading Ukraine from striking these refineries, but the lack of assistance gives Ukraine freedom of action.
original:
CNN's material about Ukrainian drones also analyzes their attacks on Russian refineries.

It is reported that Ukraine is targeting Russian energy facilities that involve a lot of Western technology, which is much more difficult for Russia to purchase. This causes more damage than random hits on oil refineries.

Experts believe these attacks could have a greater impact on the Russian economy than current sanctions.

12-14% of Russian oil refining capacity is already offline, pushing up oil prices, with Brent up nearly 13%, "leading policymakers in the United States to worry about their potential economic impact in a crucial election year."

An American official once again anonymously confirmed to CNN that the United States is actively dissuading Ukraine from striking these refineries.

“We have long stated that we do not encourage or allow terrorist attacks inside Russia,” the source said.

Western sanctions were initially aimed at keeping Russian oil and gas on the markets, says Helima Croft, managing director and head of global commodity strategy at investment bank RBC Capital Markets.

"That was the deal with Ukraine: We'll give you money, we'll give you weapons, but stay away from export sites, stay away from Russian energy because we don't want a massive energy crisis," Croft said.

However, the lack of assistance from the United States gives Ukraine "some freedom of action."

“If they don't get the weapons and money they were promised, what is their incentive to honor this deal with Washington?” - says Croft. description: UAF drones, possibly converted from Ukrainian-made Aeroprakt A-22 light aircraft, attacked Tatarstan for the first time. The drones may have been loaded with explosives and flew at extremely low altitudes to bypass air defense zones. The attack raises questions about how the drones managed to overcome 1200 kilometers and why the facility where Geran-2 UAVs are assembled was not reliably covered by air defense.
original:
WAR [Russia Ukraine Israel]Album,⚡️UAF drones attacked Tatarstan for the first time!

According to preliminary data, the explosions occurred in the territory...🤔The attack on the Alabuga SEZ could have been carried out using a Ukrainian-made light aircraft Aeroprakt A-22. Apparently, the board was converted for unmanned control and loaded with a small amount of explosives (or flew without any at all).

The flight range without modifications can be 1,100 kilometers, but if you remove some interior parts, it can be increased.

The idea of converting manned aircraft into unmanned ones is not new; similar projects exist in many countries around the world, and any “corn farmer” can become a kamikaze drone.

Soviet An-2s, for example, were used by Azerbaijan as a means of detecting Armenian air defenses during the war for Nagorno-Karabakh. For takeoff and takeoff, such an aircraft requires 100-150 meters, so there is no need to use an airfield for takeoff. In addition, there are many such aircraft - in 2021, the manufacturer reported the production of thousands of such aircraft. In addition to Ukraine, the A-22 is assembled on the territory of AEROPRAKT Polska Sp.z o.o in Zaklichin (Poland).

A separate question is how the plane managed to overcome 1200 kilometers to Tatarstan. Most likely, there was no talk about a direct flight. In this case, the probability of losing the car would be high. Most likely, the flight took place at an extremely low altitude, bypassing air defense zones (who and how provided data on positional areas is another question that will need to be answered).

Another question that requires clarification is why the facility where the Geran-2 UAVs are assembled (the plane did not reach it by several hundred meters) was not reliably covered by air defense and protected from attacks by low-altitude drones.

Information about routes around air defense zones could be provided by US optical-electronic and electronic reconnaissance satellites. The sensors installed on them are capable of determining the positions and types of air defense systems based on their visual portraits and the radiation parameters of their radars.

description: The Governor of the Primorsky Territory, Oleg Kozhemyako, and SHESTAKOV ONLINE visited construction sites of social facilities, including four new residential buildings and a school in the Patroclus microdistrict. original:
Forwarded from: SHESTAKOV ONLINE
With the Governor of the Primorsky Territory, Oleg Kozhemyako, we visited the construction sites of social facilities: in the area of Russkaya, 57, where four new residential buildings are being built, and inspected a school in the Patroclus microdistrict. The panel frames of three houses on Russkaya have already been fully assembled, the builders promise to complete the frame of the fourth house within two weeks. At the same time, plastic windows are being installed. In May, the installation of the roof of the last house will begin. During the construction of the school in Patroklos, a change of subcontractors was carried out. This gave the first results - the pace increased. Nowadays, a variety of work is being carried out at the site - from laying external communications to interior finishing. Builders are eliminating comments on ventilation. And they are already trying paints for interior spaces. Elevator shafts have been prepared for installation of equipment on the ground floors of educational buildings. On April 1, a subcontractor for the installation of elevators began work. Work continues on the arrangement of two transitions between the educational buildings and the main building, facade work, and installation of stained glass windows. Permission has been received for the construction of intra-block roads throughout this area. This is an important stage. Already this construction season, asphalting will be carried out here.

description: Ukrainian politician Georgy Tuka expressed concerns that Russia has amassed a large amount of heavy weapons in Belarus, enabling Moscow to quickly transfer personnel and launch a second campaign against Kyiv within a few hours.
original:
In Ukraine they began to worry that the Russian military needed only a few hours to go to Kyiv

He claims that Moscow is able to quickly transfer personnel there and “arrange a second campaign against Kyiv.” And this will take a few hours.

Although at the moment there is no objective data on concentration and preparation for offensive actions from the north, he noted. @NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

description: Today marks the anniversary of Vladlen Tatarsky's death, a renowned military correspondent, writer, and officer. He was a prominent figure, embodying a new standard of journalism, actively involved in volunteer activities, and fought for his country. His legacy lives on as a national hero.
original:
Today is the anniversary of the death of Vladlen Tatarsky (military correspondent Maxim Fomin). Vladlen was a simple guy from Makeyevka. Over time, he became a famous militiaman, writer and military officer, whom perhaps everyone knows. For his active position, the enemy made Tatarsky one of his priority targets.

In fact, it was he who embodied by his example a new standard of journalism. Vladlen fought, filmed, and was actively involved in volunteer activities. His “main military show of the country, evening Vladlen,” was watched and loved by the country.

Maxim Fomin remained a national hero even after his death. There will be a Novorossiya, there will be! - the journalist liked to say.

Fortunately, he waited until new regions joined Russia. And our victory will also definitely be, at least for the sake of all the guys and girls who defend the honor and freedom of our country at their posts.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: Ruslan Mikula, co-founder of the DeepState project, shared insights on conducting OSINT reconnaissance using open sources and ground informants, verifying front-line data, and providing a comprehensive war picture without compromising the Ukrainian Defense Forces. He also discussed the reliability of official sources, cooperation with the Department of Defense, and fact-checking Russian military reports.
original: An interesting guest in the Militarny studio is the co-founder of the DeepState project Ruslan Mikula. A whole hour of extremely useful information: on how to conduct OSINT reconnaissance based on open sources and your own informants on the ground; about verification of data coming from the front; about how to provide society with the most complete picture of the war, but at the same time not harm the Ukrainian Defense Forces; on the reliability of official/government sources and DeepState's cooperation with the Department of Defense; and also about how to check the words of Russian military officers and reports of the Russian Ministry of Defense. I’m citing only the very beginning of the broadcast. The full story is here. @yigal_levin

description: A fire broke out in a residential building in Istanbul's Besiktas district, caused by an explosion of oxygen cylinders in a basement being renovated for a nightclub. The incident resulted in 29 fatalities and 1 injury. Authorities have detained 5 suspects and are investigating the incident.
original:
Forwarded from: Rusya İstanbul Başkonsolosluğu
❗️On April 2, 2024, at about 13:00 local time, a fire broke out in a residential building located in the Gairettepe quarter (Besiktas district of Istanbul) as a result of the explosion of oxygen cylinders in a basement rented for a nightclub, which was under renovation work.📍 According to emergency services, the death toll from the fire is 29 people. 1 person who was injured was taken to the hospital. Law enforcement authorities began an investigation, during which 5 people suspected of possible involvement in the incident were detained. At the moment, information about the injured Russian citizens and appeals regarding this case have not been received by the Consulate General. 📍The Consulate General is in contact with emergency services
Istanbul.

description: Ukraine's Prosecutor General Andrii Kostin met with the Attorney General of England and Wales Victoria Prentice, the Ambassador of Great Britain to the Netherlands Joanna Roper, and the head of the Department for the Protection of Human Rights of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Commonwealth of Nations and of the development of Great Britain, Geisel Cameron, to discuss strengthening cooperation in building a network of comprehensive responsibility for Russia's international crimes.

event: Criticisms of the European Union's Green Deal
description: The European Union's Green Deal is criticized for being dogmatic, economically problematic, and technologically immature. It burdens European industry with costs and uncertainty, limiting its international competitiveness. The energy transition within the Green Deal framework is a major disruptor affecting the German and European economies.
original:
🇪🇺The European Union's Green Deal should be criticized for three reasons:▪️it is dogmatic because it does not provide for alternative scenarios;▪️it is very problematic economically because it burdens European industry with costs and uncertainty, limiting its international competitiveness;▪️it is technologically immature and unrealistic: no There are no market-ready technologies or financial means to achieve the European Commission's goal of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to zero by 2050. The energy transition, carried out within the framework of the Green Deal, is one of the most powerful disruptors affecting the German economy and therefore on the European economy. This policy is pursued primarily by the European Commission, headed by Ursula von der Leyen, and the cabinet of Olaf Scholz.

Economic indicators have deteriorated and energy prices have become a burden for both the economy and society, but political decisions continue to follow the policies of Brussels, writes Ulrike Reisner, an independent political commentator from Austria. https://ru.valdaiclub.com/a/highlights /pora-pokhoronit-zelyenyy-kurs/🖇️The first and second parts of this analysis were published earlier.#GlobalAlternatives#EU#energyValdai ClubThe dark side of Brussels energy policy: time to bury the Green DealThe energy transition carried out within the framework of the Green Deal concept is one of the most powerful destructive factors affecting the economy...

description: Workers hired by Moscow's Progress Group to rebuild houses in Mariupol claim they are owed 3 million and have not received payment. The company allegedly borrowed money from local workers and disappeared, leaving the buildings to be transferred to other companies.
original:
The workers complain that the Moscow company, which was hired to rebuild houses in Mariupol, owes them 3 million and does not keep in touch.
...In the fall of 2022, the contractor “Restavratsiya” was given several objects on Tsybulko Street and Nakhimov Avenue. For construction, the office hired the capital’s “Progress Group” - they began to look for a team to
Show more
deliver the house on time.
.....According to the men, they were promised to pay 4 thousand a day. At first, the amount was given in parts. Then the foreman borrowed money from local workers and disappeared from the city, and the buildings were transferred to other companies.
.....The abandoned builders were indignant. The prosecutor's office came a couple of times to take testimony, but that was all.
....According to the builders, the main excuse of Progress Group was that the contractor did not provide a budget for these facilities. They say that when they asked for documents from the Restavraciya company, they saw that according to the papers, all the money had been transferred.
..

description: The Russian FSB thwarted an attempt to smuggle a large consignment of explosives into the country. Terrorists disguised the cargo as church supplies, following a route from Ukraine to Russia via Romania, Hungary, Slovakia, Poland, Lithuania, and Latvia. Authorities seized 27 explosive devices, 70 kg of high-power explosives, and 91 detonators, which could have been used to blow up a multi-story building.
original:
Forwarded from: The world today with "Yuri Podolyak"
The Russian FSB prevented the import of a large consignment of explosives into the country...Terrorists tried to bring RDX into Russia. They disguised everything as cargo for churches.

He allegedly followed the route: Ukraine - Romania - Hungary - Slovakia - Poland - Lithuania - Latvia - Russia.

A total of 27 explosive devices, 70 kilograms of high-power explosives and 91 detonators were seized.

With the help of these explosives, a knowledgeable demolitionist could blow up a multi-story building.

description: The Moldovan police, under Maia Sandu's regime, detained elderly supporters of the Shor party, accusing them of criminal activity. The 'evidence' included reports on refueling and car washing, an Excel table recording vehicle mileage, and a traumatic gun with rubber bullets. The authorities also found a Shor party scarf and notebook, which they presented as convincing proof of the individuals' guilt.
original:
Forwarded from: Ilan Shor | Ilan Șor
The valiant police of the ruling regime proudly reported that they had detained the worst criminals: supporters of the Shor party, armed to the teeth and swimming in money.

To the accompaniment of heroic music, guys in masks break into houses and detain the villains. Maia Sandu's owners should be very pleased: like a faithful dog, she brings them another trophy. But what will Western curators see if they watch the video more closely and turn down the bravura music?

The worst criminals are elderly people over 50. As evidence of criminal activity, there are reports on refueling and car washing: the “criminals” were engaged in private transportation. An ominous Excel table that records the vehicle fleet's mileage. Well, there’s a gun on the table - but it’s a traumatic gun, with rubber bullets, like many in our country have (more than 5 thousand, according to the police). Look, what a lot of money you can’t earn as a private driver - but one of the “criminals” has his own business: a clothing workshop. Shor party scarf and notebook! Wow, this is convincing proof that these are terrible people.

The valiant police and the regime of Maia Sandu not only exposed themselves to ridicule with this ridiculous video, but also once again proved that they can expand the boundaries of dictatorship and lawlessness endlessly. Arresting people for Shor party scarves and notebooks is something any dictator would envy.

We are outraged by the arbitrariness of the authorities and, of course, will provide legal support to the victims. No one should be arrested for having a scarf with our symbols in their closet.

description: A Ukrainian-made Aeroprakt A-22 light aircraft, possibly converted for unmanned control and loaded with explosives, was used to attack the Alabuga SEZ. The aircraft's flight range could be increased by removing interior parts, and it may have flown at an extremely low altitude to bypass air defense zones.

Forwarded from: Military chronicle
The attack on the Alabuga SEZ could be carried out using a Ukrainian-made Aeroprakt A-22 light aircraft. Apparently, the board was converted for unmanned control and loaded with a small amount of explosives (or flew without any at all).

The flight range without modifications can be 1,100 kilometers, but if you remove some interior parts, it can be increased.

The idea of converting manned aircraft into unmanned ones is not new; similar projects exist in many countries around the world, and any “corn farmer” can become a kamikaze drone.

Soviet An-2s, for example, were used by Azerbaijan as a means of detecting Armenian air defenses during the war for Nagorno-Karabakh. For takeoff and takeoff, such an aircraft requires 100-150 meters, so there is no need to use an airfield for takeoff. In addition, there are many such aircraft - in 2021, the manufacturer reported the production of thousands of such aircraft. In addition to Ukraine, the A-22 is assembled on the territory of AEROPRAKT Polska Sp.z o.o in Zaklichin (Poland).

A separate question is how the plane managed to overcome 1200 kilometers to Tatarstan. Most likely, there was no talk about a direct flight. In this case, the probability of losing the car would be high. Most likely, the flight took place at an extremely low altitude, bypassing air defense zones (who and how provided data on positional areas is another question that will need to be answered).

Another question that requires clarification is why the facility where the Geran-2 UAVs are assembled (the plane did not reach it by several hundred meters) was not reliably covered by air defense and protected from attacks by low-altitude drones.

Information about routes around air defense zones could be provided by US optical-electronic and electronic reconnaissance satellites. The sensors installed on them are capable of determining the positions and types of air defense systems by their visual portraits and the radiation parameters of their radars. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Subscribe to Military ChronicleMilitary Chronicle on VK

description: Protests erupted in Van, Turkey, after authorities overturned the election victory of opposition mayoral candidate Abdullah Zeidan from the pro-Kurdish People's Equality and Democracy Party (DEM). Zeidan won with 55% of the vote, but the Ministry of Justice declared him ineligible to participate in the election just two days prior, citing a 2016 arrest and subsequent conviction.
original:
Protests broke out in the Turkish city of Van after authorities overturned the victory of an opposition mayoral candidate. Abdullah Zeidan, the Van municipality candidate from the pro-Kurdish People's Equality and Democracy Party (DEM), won the election with 55%. At the same time, the candidate from Erdogan’s party scored only 27% here: as in many regions of Turkey, the party of the current president was defeated. However, in Van the results were canceled, taking away the victory from Zeidan. Just two days before the elections, the country's Ministry of Justice declared that the politician has no rights to engage in political activities.

“On March 29, that is, two days before the elections, the Turkish Ministry of Justice issued a decision regarding Zeidan to ban him from participating in the elections. However, his name was already on the ballot. And now the election commission, guided by this decision of the Ministry of Justice, has issued a resolution depriving Zeidan of the right to occupy the mayor’s chair,” orientalist Ruslan Suleymanov explained the situation to “Caution, News.”

The fact is that back in 2016, Zeidan was detained and accused of attending the funeral of members of the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK), which is banned in the country. In January 2018, he was sentenced to eight years in prison; he was able to be released only in 2022. After this, Zeidan and his other comrades who fight for the rights of the Kurds were able to restore their rights, which were limited by a criminal record, including the ability to run for office.

“In general, this is not the first time that the central authorities have put pressure on politicians elected from the pro-Kurdish party. Thus, after the local elections in 2019, at the request of the Turkish Ministry of Internal Affairs in the southeast of the country, 48 of the 65 elected mayors from the pro-Kurdish party were removed from office,” says Suleymanov. Today at two o'clock in the afternoon, party supporters went out to protests, where they demanded to cancel the decision of the Ministry of Justice. As a result, clashes with the police occurred. The DEM party said it would appeal the authorities' decision.

description: During the occupation, a young girl played a crucial role in the resistance movement. Despite her father being a Nazi, she secretly delivered messages to resistance members hidden in her boots. She would jump rope in the city square, pretending to straighten her laces, to pass on information. The girl also gathered intel on enemy movements, witnessing arrests and hiding in a basement to avoid capture.
original:
​​​​📌📌📌STRANGE GIRL.

During the occupation, everyone was busy with business. There was almost no food - it had to be obtained. This was done by young and old.
The girl, having eaten a boiled potato in the morning, went to the city square with a skipping rope and jumped there all day.
She was so thin that her bones must have rattled as she galloped. Any adult ballerina would be tired of jumping around so much on one potato.
The girl was jumping.
In her boots were messages for the resistance members received from her brother. She took them out, pretending to straighten her laces.
Sometimes she didn't get anything, but just jumped.
On such days, she knew exactly how many cars with soldiers went and where they went.
Or when and where the cars with the officers went.
The girl's dad was a Nazi, but she was not.
They say that one day she was riding a bicycle to convey a message. And she witnessed the arrest. They tried to take her too, but she ran away and hid in the basement. She sat in the basement for several days. She had apples.
Mom, knowing what her children were doing, did not even dare to make a fuss and look for them.
Before the war, the girl was very plump. Because I ate delicious chocolates every day. During the war, she told herself every day that she hated eating, so as not to go crazy remembering those chocolates.
Then the war ended, the girl grew up and became a movie star.
Then she left the cinema and saved other children from hunger.
And everyone loved her. And everyone still loves Audrey Hepburn. Lilith Mazikinahttps://t.me/tkacheva_svetlanaN/5536

event: Meeting on Master Plan for Tiksi-Naiba Agglomeration
description: Head of Yakutia Aisen Nikolaev met with developers of the master plan for the supporting Arctic agglomeration of federal significance 'Tiksi-Naiba'. The meeting aimed to discuss the development of the region, which faces harsh conditions, including long polar nights, severe snowstorms, and worn-out infrastructure.
location: Tiksi, Bulunsky District, Sakha Republic, Russia
original:
Forwarded from: Yakutia 2100
What do the residents of the Arctic want? Head of Yakutia Aisen Nikolaev held a meeting with the developers of the master plan for the supporting Arctic agglomeration of federal significance “Tiksi-Naiba”.
Let’s make a reservation right away that the development of a master plan by the Siberian Laboratory of Urbanism is still at the initial stage.

However, in addition to the inevitable bureaucratic procedures, the company’s specialists managed to visit Tiksi and Naibe to see the situation with their own eyes and establish contacts with local residents.

The southern coast of the Arctic Ocean is far from the most comfortable place on this planet.
In addition to the gruelingly long polar night, there are often severe snowstorms with wind speeds of up to 35 m/sec (on average 35 days a year), and in the short summer (2 months) the air temperature does not rise above +7.5 degrees.

And yet, in these extremely harsh conditions, 4,878 people live in the territory of the future agglomeration, from infants to people over 70 years old.
Life, frankly speaking, is very, very difficult. For example, the housing stock in the village of Tiksi is 65% worn out. And the average wear and tear of engineering infrastructure is 70%.

The situation in Naibe is even worse. The entire housing stock here is actually in a state of disrepair and is not subject to major repairs. There is no water supply or sewerage.
And also off-road. From Tiksi to Naiba can only be reached along a 135-kilometer winter road. Naturally, only in winter and only after severe frosts hit.
And many other big and small problems.

It would seem that since everything is so bad, then we need to run away from these homeless places without looking back.
But! 65% of Tiksi residents surveyed said that they like living in this unkind land. And in Naibe there are as many as 97% of them!

The results of a survey about the problems of future agglomeration that require priority solutions are also very interesting.
Naturally, dilapidated housing and deterioration of engineering systems came first.

The second stage involves cleaning up accumulated waste. There really is a huge problem with this case. Abandoned, gradually collapsing houses and industrial buildings, half-submerged ships rotting in the water, heaps of scrap metal of unknown origin, etc. They just create a depressing impression.

But in third place was the lack of stable Internet. The lack of modern infocommunications is felt by residents even more acutely than hard-to-reach and expensive logistics, which has moved to fourth place.

We are not yet ready to evaluate the work of the Siberian Laboratory of Urbanism. It's difficult to evaluate a master plan that doesn't exist yet.
But there was one moment (purely subjective) that I didn’t like for sure. In our (un)biased opinion, the realization of the potential of future agglomeration is too extended in time.
For example, the modernization of the Tiksi seaport is planned for 2033, and the deep-water terminal in Naibe will appear only in 2034.

For comparison:
Geological exploration and surveys are now being completed at the Kyuchus gold deposit (in the neighboring Ust-Yansky region), they plan to begin designing a mining and processing complex and begin to build infrastructure.

In the period 2025–2027, the White Gold company (a joint venture of Seligdar PJSC and RT-Business Development LLC) will construct the mining and processing plant with subsequent commissioning.

And already in 2028, the mining and processing plant in Kyuchus should reach its design capacity to produce at least 10 tons of gold per year, no later than June 30 of the same year by connecting to electricity from the nuclear power plant in Ust-Kuiga in an amount of at least 35 MW.

Why the development of the Tiksi-Naiba agglomeration should lag behind its neighbors by as much as six years is not very clear.
It seems to us that the emergence of a deep-water sea terminal in Naibe should be somehow connected with the construction of a nuclear power plant and the development of Kyuchus.#Arctic#Yakutia#masterplanTelegram Aisen Nikolaev, Head of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia). Official channel. description: Doctor Serhiy Vlasyuk, an ultrasound diagnostician, died saving lives in Mariupol's City Hospital No. 4 during heavy shelling by Russian occupiers on April 2, 2022. Despite the danger, he continued to work, rescuing wounded civilians until his death.
original:
😔He died saving the lives of patients...🚑In Mariupol, which was disappearing before our eyes, medical workers were always nearby ㅡ in the operating rooms or in the basements. They saved the people of Mariupol at the cost of their own lives under the constant shelling of the occupiers. Today, let's remember Serhiy Vlasyuk, an ultrasound diagnostician of the reception department of Matsuk Hospital No. 4. 👨‍⚕️Serhiy Vlasyuk is an ultrasound doctor of the first category. Studied at Luhansk State Medical University. He started medical practice in 1998. He worked in the emergency medical department of Mariupol City Hospital No. 4. As colleagues recall, despite the heavy hostilities, Serhii Volodymyrovych went to work every day and rescued wounded townspeople from February 28 until the day of his death. 😢April 2, 2022, Russian occupiers from heavy Artillery shelled City Hospital No. 4. It also reached the reception department, where Serhii Volodymyrovych assisted new patients. An explosion rang out nearby and a shrapnel hit the doctor in the chest. Serhii Vlasiuk died instantly. The next day, they tried to bury him in the hospital yard.

The President of Ukraine, Volodymyr Zelenskyi, posthumously awarded the Order of Merit, III degree. We remember!🕯

original:

It is noted that the detainee, on the instructions of the SBU curator, was planning an assassination attempt on three employees of the military-civil administration. He was promised $10 thousand for the crime.

The department emphasized that Ukraine’s accomplice determined the route of movement of the victims and installed an explosive device under the car’s gas cylinder. As a result of the attack, three victims suffered serious bodily injuries. “The defendant was taken into custody at the request of the investigator, he confessed and assisted the investigative authorities,” the Investigative Committee concluded. Subscribe to IZ.RU

description: Russian President Putin expressed dissatisfaction with the current migration policy, citing instances where individuals with criminal records easily obtained labor patents and applied for citizenship without knowing basic Russian. He emphasized the need for modern digital and electronic biometric databases to mitigate risks and relapses of illegal emigration.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
Putin criticized the current migration policy: When you begin to understand the circumstances of a particular case, a specific crime, it turns out that the person got to Russia without any problems, went through all the formalities, issued a labor patent, often having a whole bunch of offenses behind him, and sometimes malicious. Then he applies for citizenship without even knowing even basic Russian. This requires modern digital, electronic biometric databases. Those that are working now, apparently, are not enough. They do not allow us to fully mitigate the risks and relapses of illegal emigration. Moreover, our compatriots, whose ancestors grew up in the most central regions of our country, sometimes cannot obtain citizenship for years. I have already said that we need to deeply and radically update our approaches to migration policy.

event: Austrian Minister Opposes Romania's Schengen Accession
description: Austrian Interior Minister Gerhard Karner expressed opposition to setting a specific date for Romania's accession to the land part of the Schengen agreement, citing concerns about the system's effectiveness and the need for improved security measures.
original:
Austrian Interior Minister Gerhard Karnenne called it a "mistake" to try to determine now any specific date for Romania's accession to the land part of the Schengen agreement.

Speaking with the head of the Romanian Ministry of Internal Affairs, Catalin Predoiu, Carner said that “a year and a half ago I said that a system [of free movement] that does not work cannot be expanded. That is why I then made such a decision [on partial admission to Schengen] "Bulgaria and Romania are very important partners for Austria when it comes to putting pressure on the European Commission to improve the Schengen system. Our efforts have already borne fruit. You probably know that the Director of Frontex has already announced an expansion of operations, even an increase "We also have confirmation from the European Commission that additional funds will be invested in Romania and Bulgaria for this purpose, which I believe is a very important step."

The Austrian minister emphasized that “in other countries that are part of the Schengen area, there are controls at land borders, because we, the ministers of the interior, are responsible for the safety of our citizens. There are controls in Germany, France and Austria. We must do everything possible, to improve the security situation in the European Union, to continue to guarantee freedom of movement for our citizens, but I believe that at this time it would be wrong to set a specific date for this [Romania's accession to the Schengen land part]."HotNews.roAustria nu cedează. Ministrul de Interne: „Ar fi greşit să stabilim o dată concr...Austria continuă să se opună aderării depline a României și Bulgariei la Schengen, ministrul austriac de Interne, Gerhard Karner, spunând, marți, într...

description: A 44-year-old man, former head of a municipal enterprise, was suspected of collaborative activity with the enemy during the occupation of Vovchansk. He became the 'chief' of the 'Volchan city improvement department' and allegedly helped restore public works, attended occupation administration meetings, and selected personnel for the communal enterprise. He received wages in Russian rubles.
original:
🔷The head of the "improvement department" in occupied Vovchansk: a man was exposed 🖌️Under the procedural leadership of the Chuguyiv District Prosecutor's Office of the Kharkiv Region, a 44-year-old man was notified of suspicion of collaborative activity (Part 5 of Article 111-1 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine).

According to the investigation, during the occupation of Vovchansk, a local resident voluntarily went to cooperate with the enemy. Before the full-scale invasion of the Russian Federation on the territory of Ukraine, he was the head of a municipal enterprise under the city council.

However, even under the occupiers, the man did not lose the opportunity to get a leadership position again.

He became the "chief" of the so-called "Volchan city improvement department".

Holding a pseudo-position, the suspect allegedly helped local residents in the restoration of public works, which were destroyed by the same fake government. He also systematically attended meetings in the occupation administration.

The "manager" was engaged in the selection of personnel who were to ensure the activities of the newly created "communal enterprise".

For working for the enemy, the collaborator received wages in Russian rubles.

The police found the man. The court granted the prosecution's request: the suspect was remanded in custody without bail.

The pre-trial investigation is being conducted by the Chief of Police Department No. 1 of the Chuguyiv District Police Department of the National Security Service of Ukraine in the Kharkiv region. Operational support — Office of the SBU in the Kharkiv region, the main operational and investigative department of the 4th border detachment (Kharkiv) of the DPS of Ukraine. ⚔️Kharkiv regional prosecutor's office

description: Artillerymen in the Ugledar direction are conducting intense operations, firing conventional and high-precision ammunition, including Krasnopol shells. The precision-guided munitions enable targeted strikes against militant concentrations and moving armored vehicles.
original:
️In the Ugledar direction, the situation is consistently tense. This means several shots, and the enemy immediately flies back. Every second counts.

“After shooting, you need to lower the barrel into this slingshot. The response was flying, and we even had to not repel the gun and leave the firing position. I immediately launch, the gunner and I understand each other and, as we move, we lower the barrel down,” says the mechanic-driver of the self-propelled gun “Msta-S” with the call sign “Steel”.

The artillerymen fire not only conventional, but also high-precision ammunition, including Krasnopol shells. Precision-guided munitions fly further. They make it possible to carry out targeted strikes against concentrations of militants and are guaranteed to hit moving armored vehicles.

“The artillery gun stood in such a place, on a slope, that the shell always fell in front of it. And “Krasnopol” - it was illuminated, and it doesn’t matter to it: slope or not slope - it falls from top to bottom on the target. There was no such thing that we didn’t get hit by Krasnopol. We always hit the target,” says the senior officer at the battery with the call sign “Don 20.” https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301686VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 2 min 47 s from 1 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! event: Bill Adopted to Subordinate Cadet Corps to Ministry of Defense
description: The State Duma adopted a bill in its first reading, which would make all cadet corps subordinate to the Ministry of Defense. The bill aims to bring Cossack cadet corps and naval cadet corps under the Ministry's purview. This move is expected to strengthen the country's military education system.
original:
All cadet corps will become subordinate to the Ministry of Defense. This bill was adopted by State Duma deputies in the first reading on April 2. The bill supplements the list of educational institutions subordinate to the Ministry of Defense with the Cossack cadet corps and the cadet (naval cadet) corps. The author of the bill was the head of the Duma defense committee Andrei Kartopolov. The bill was submitted to the Duma in November 2023.

The head of the Duma Defense Committee, Andrei Kartapolov, explained that many soldiers and officers heroically performing combat missions in the Northern Military District zone graduated from various pre-university institutions of the Ministry of Defense and other specialized departmental structures - Suvorov, Nakhimov and cadet schools. The Ministry of Defense now has 33 cadet corps, in which about 20 thousand teenagers study. The Ministry of Emergency Situations, the Ministry of Internal Affairs, the Federal Protective Service and the Investigative Committee now have similar schools. Be with us - First Cossack

description: The 'Ticket to the Future' project, part of the presidential initiative 'Education', allowed Amur region schoolchildren to explore career options. The project involved 244 schools, 29,000 students, and 450 teacher-navigators, providing professional tests, excursions, and master classes.
original: Schoolchildren from the Amur region received a “Ticket to the Future” for the sixth time. “Ticket to the Future” is such a cool project where schoolchildren can find themselves and understand what they want to do while still at school. It operates in all 89 regions of the country and in Baikonur. Last year, the Amur region participated in it for the sixth time, and here is this experience in numbers: “Ticket to the Future” was supported by 244 schools in the region; Over 29 thousand students joined the project, half for the first time; ~450 teacher-navigators helped Amur schoolchildren comprehend the world of professions ;1,597 schoolchildren passed professional tests at Amur universities and colleges; For 882 schoolchildren, professional tests were held at enterprises in Amur cities and regions; 760 schoolchildren went on excursions to production; 202 schoolchildren attended master classes with real specialists from companies and organizations; 20 employers of the region held career guidance events for children; 16,243 schoolchildren who completed all stages of the project received recommendations on choosing a profession. Note that the project is being implemented within the framework of the presidential initiative “Education” - a national project that was previously initiated by Vladimir Putin. #National Projects Make Life in the Amur Region Better

event: Regional Stage of School Museum Competition
description: The regional stage of the all-Russian school museum competition 'Soldiers of the Great Fatherland' has begun in the Kherson region. The competition, organized by the United Russia party, aims to honor the memory of soldiers participating in the special military operation and encourage children and teachers to study Russian history and its heroes.
original:
Forwarded from: Vladimir Saldo
The regional stage of the all-Russian school museum competition “Soldiers of the Great Fatherland” has started in the Kherson region. This year, the competition of school museum teams was dedicated to the feat of the heroes of a special military operation, it is held by the United Russia party. The goal of the competition is to perpetuate the memory of our soldiers, participants of the Northern Military District. And also to encourage children and teachers to study more deeply the history of Russia and its heroes.

The winners will be determined in 2 categories: “Best school city museum” and “Best school rural museum”; they will represent the region at the federal stage and receive a financial reward.

Applications for participation are accepted until April 30. They can be sent to the email of the regional Organizing Committee info@herson.er.ru.

Many natives of the Kherson region showed themselves on the battlefields of the Northern Military District. Unfortunately, there are deaths. As part of the competition, their relatives can donate personal belongings of soldiers to school museums to create memory corners. They died defending Russia from neo-fascists, our youth should not forget them.@SALDO_VGA

If you find a suspicious or explosive object (grenade, shell, mine, bomb, etc.), do not come close to it, contact people nearby and ask them to immediately report the dangerous find to police by calling 102. If any work is being done nearby or people live nearby, warn them; it is necessary to turn off the engines, stop the equipment in the same position and remove the people in it to a safe distance or to shelter. Do not let anyone close (especially children) until the police or bomb squad arrive, while you are in a place that protects you from a possible explosion. Do not allow random people to touch a dangerous object or try to neutralize it. Pay attention to abandoned bags, briefcases, packages, toys and other unattended items that may contain improvised explosive devices. Immediately report the find to the police. Do not open the discovered packages and bags under any circumstances, do not touch them and warn people standing nearby about the possible danger.🇷🇺Official website of the administration🏛Head of the Administration of the Volnovakha Municipal District

Then he applies for citizenship without even knowing even basic Russian. This requires modern digital, electronic biometric databases. Those that are working now, apparently, are not enough. They do not allow us to fully mitigate the risks and relapses of illegal emigration. Moreover, our compatriots, whose ancestors grew up in the most central regions of our country, sometimes cannot obtain citizenship for years. I have already said that we need to deeply and radically update our approaches to migration policy.

event: Refuted Claim of Explosion at Electrical Substation
description: Ukrainian propaganda falsely claimed an explosion at an electrical substation in Sevastopol, citing the State Intelligence Directorate of Ukraine, which allegedly caused a power outage in the city. However, the governor of Sevastopol refuted this information, revealing that a short circuit at the substation caused a temporary power outage, which has since been restored.
original:
Ukrainian propaganda celebrates yet another fictitious “victory.” Thus, the fakes announced the alleged explosion of an electrical substation in Sevastopol, citing their sources in the State Intelligence Directorate of Ukraine, as a result of which, according to them, there was a loss of power in the city.

This information was refuted by the governor of Sevastopol on his telegram channel. It turned out that the Internet warriors decided to pass off a short circuit at the substation, because of which the light actually went out for several hours, as their personal achievement. Moreover, there is no news about the attack on Sevastopol in the Ukrainian State Intelligence Service channel. By the way, power supply in the city has already been restored.

description: To commemorate the 215th anniversary of Nikolai Gogol's birth, an exhibition was organized for students of the Tavria School, showcasing his works, including 'Evenings on a Farm near Dikanka', 'The Inspector General', and 'Dead Souls'. The interactive event featured a quiz on Gogol's biography and a film still guessing game, engaging students in literature.
original:
An exhibition dedicated to the work of Gogol was organized for the students of the Tavria School. In honor of the 215th anniversary of the birth of Nikolai Gogol, schoolchildren were presented with an exhibition at which the writer’s works were presented. The children became more familiar with the books “Evenings on a Farm near Dikanka”, “The Inspector General” and “Dead Souls”.

To prevent the lecture from turning into a boring lesson, the students played a quiz - they had to answer questions related to the biography of Gogol. The fun didn’t end there - the children were also shown stills from films based on Gogol’s works; they had to guess which book the photographs belonged to. Thanks to such interactive lessons, children are immersed in the world of literature with great interest.

event: Putin's Speech at Ministry of Internal Affairs
description: President Putin addressed the expanded board of the Ministry of Internal Affairs, outlining key priorities, including ensuring public order, combating extremism, and suppressing illegal migration. He emphasized the need to identify all links in the terrorist attack chain, increase preparedness for emergency situations, and update migration policy approaches.
original:
Putin speaks at the expanded board of the Ministry of Internal Affairs. The main statements from the president:

— The priorities of the Ministry of Internal Affairs are ensuring public order, combating extremism and suppressing illegal migration.

“It is important for us to identify not only the perpetrators of the terrorist attack at Crocus, but also all the links in the chain and the final beneficiaries.

“Those who use these weapons (terrorist attacks) against Russia must understand that they are double-edged.

— Internal and external threats are often intertwined. They are aimed at undermining our sovereignty.

— We need to increase preparedness for emergency situations.

— More than 3.2 million residents of Donbass and Novorossiya received Russian passports.

— It is unacceptable to use the terrorist attack in Crocus to provoke ethnic hatred.

— Modern biometric databases for migrants are needed.

— We need to radically update approaches to migration policy; our compatriots have not been able to obtain citizenship for years. Only those who respect its traditions, language and culture should be able to come and live in Russia@NeoficialniyBeZsonoV

description: A lion park in the Moscow region was flooded due to a river overflowing its banks. While most predators were evacuated, two lions, Hector and White, refused to leave and climbed onto loungers four meters high to observe the situation.
location: Pride Land zoo, Moscow Oblast, Russia
original:
In the Moscow region, a lion park was flooded - while all the predators were evacuated to land, two cats climbed higher and are not going to go anywhere. In the Pride Land zoo near Moscow, where feline predators live, the water is now knee-deep due to a river overflowing its banks. However, judging by the footage, the animals were not particularly upset by this - they frolicked happily in the water, without feeling any danger. Apparently, only the park employees are tense - they are evacuating non-domestic pets to dry enclosures. Not all the inhabitants wanted to go into cramped quarters, so two of the 14 lions, Hector and White, did not listen to anyone, but simply climbed onto the loungers at a height of four meters and watched what was happening from above.

As the workers say, the animals are calmer this way, the two of them alone, however, if the water level continues to increase, the staff will swim into the enclosure, put the naughty ones under anesthesia and take them to a safe place. In addition, local authorities and emergency services have been alerted to the threat and are monitoring the situation - as soon as the park needs help, they will immediately respond to the site.

Another eviction of British people from their homes to accommodate migrants ended in a riot.

In the UK, the city of Derby, a "migrant protection service" evicted a British family to replace them with migrants. At the beginning of the first video, probably part of the evicted family. This led to the indignation of the local community, which gathered under the house.

First, the locals drove away the car of this unknown dark service, in which most of the employees turned out to be migrants, and then they began to demand the keys to the house from them. Not having received the keys, the British began to break the gate to the garage with the help of a Bulgarian.

Later, an entire army of police arrived on the scene to protect the multicultural service and the settled migrants, but it is currently known that the so-called "migrant protection service" allegedly gave in to the British and returned the house to its owners. @vallholl

description: Counterfeit products are widespread in Europe, affecting various industries such as toys, clothes, and cosmetics. original:
Forwarded from: Chancellor's Daddy
Europe has been taken over

Counterfeits are everywhere - in toys, clothes, cosmetics. Original companies are losing billions of dollars in revenue and thousands of jobs. According to a study by the EU Intellectual Property Office (EUIPO), in Germany alone, due to the rapid activity of counterfeiters, 40 thousand positions disappeared from the labor market.

The situation in Austria is no less interesting. According to customs data, more than 194 thousand counterfeits were seized in 2023 - 586% more than in 2022. Things are especially sad with medicines: customs officers intercepted 801 thousand counterfeit drugs.

The reason is banal to the point of boredom: ordinary Europeans simply cannot afford original products. Last year's EUIPO survey showed that buying a palm is not considered something shameful by 1/3 of respondents. There are even more of them among young people. description: Britain's £1.4 billion Watchkeeper reconnaissance drone project has faced significant delays and cost overruns due to the Ministry of Defense's additional requirements, resulting in a heavier and more expensive drone that cannot operate in poor weather conditions.
original:
The Times: Expensive British Watchkeeper drones cannot fly in bad weather

Britain's $6 million Watchkeeper reconnaissance drones are unable to operate in poor weather conditions, The Times writes. .

According to ex-Deputy Head of the UK Ministry of Defense Mark Francois, the history of the Watchkeeper project, which has dragged on for almost 20 years, which cost the British budget £1.4 billion, seven times more than the original estimates, clearly demonstrates the shortcomings of the military equipment procurement system for the British Armed Forces. Watchkeeper is based on an Israeli UAV. Hermes 450, which is successfully used by the Israeli Air Force. However, the British Defense Department imposed almost 2.5 thousand additional requirements on the vehicle, which is why the drones took much longer to develop than planned, became more expensive and heavier, which negatively affected their capabilities. www.thetimes.co.ukBritish Army drones a ' disaster' and unable to fly in bad weatherWhile the Hermes 450 flies over Gaza, the UK version shows everything wrong with Ministry of Defense procurement, critics say

description: A Ukrainian drone attack in Tatarstan resulted in 13 casualties, including two minors. The drone, likely a converted light aircraft, was equipped with satellite navigation and GPS, allowing it to accurately reach its target. The attack is believed to have been carried out with Western military and intelligence support, and the route was planned to bypass or overcome air defense zones.
original:
Opinion: They saw a clear Western trace in the attack on Tatarstan: “Ukraine alone could not carry it out”
The number of victims of a Ukrainian drone attack in Tatarstan has increased to 13, two of them are minors, the Ministry of Health reported.
Show more
In videos that have gone viral on social media, an aircraft-type drone is clearly visible. What we are dealing with, Igor Korotchenko, editor-in-chief of the National Defense magazine, told Tsargrad:
“The exact version should be given by law enforcement agencies and intelligence agencies. We can only comment based on the available video footage. I believe this is a light aircraft, possibly a two-seater, that has been converted into a kamikaze drone. Accordingly, he had the opportunity to cover a long route.
Being retrofitted with satellite navigation elements, GPS and the corresponding control system could quite accurately reach the target of attack. Obviously, when planning the flight, Western intelligence data was used to choose the most optimal route from the point of view of passing through air defense zones, both in altitude and heading.
This is a complex terrorist attack. Of course, Ukraine alone could not accomplish it. There was Western military and intelligence support. I believe the attack was carried out from Ukrainian territory. And the route is built in such a way as to either bypass or overcome air defense zones.”
