event: Submission of Bills to State Duma
description: Bills aimed at recognizing foreign organizations as undesirable and establishing administrative and criminal liability for participation in their activities have been submitted to the State Duma. The initiative, co-authored by the Chairman of the State Duma Committee on Security and Anti-Corruption, targets foreign organizations founded by government agencies that pose a threat to Russia's security.
original:
Bills “On Amendments to Articles 4.5 and 20.33 of the Code of the Russian Federation on Administrative Offenses” (https://sozd.duma.gov.ru/bill/590886-8) and “On Amendments to Article 284” have been submitted to the State Duma for consideration. -1 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation" (https://sozd.duma.gov.ru/bill/590898-8).
Show more
The changes will provide the opportunity to recognize the activities of foreign organizations as undesirable, even if their founders or participants are government agencies of a foreign state, and will also make it possible to establish appropriate administrative and criminal liability for participation in their activities.
She co-authored this initiative together with the Chairman of the State Duma Committee on Security and Anti-Corruption Vasily Piskarev. The proposal was supported by the Government and the Supreme Court of the Russian Federation.
The importance of the initiative lies in the fact that it is foreign organizations, whose founders are foreign government agencies, that have now intensified activities that pose a threat to the security of our country. However, according to current legislation, it is possible to recognize as undesirable the activities of only non-governmental organizations.
At the same time, the package of bills does not affect international intergovernmental organizations of which the Russian Federation is a member.
Today, in the face of constant threats to the security of our country, the fight against those who pose this threat is the most important national task. Our priority now is to maintain the cohesion and stability of Russian society. We are confident that the proposed changes will have a positive impact on our policy in the field of preventing outside interference.

description: The FSB intercepted a cargo of explosives hidden in Orthodox icons and church utensils, which originated from Ukraine and passed through several European Union countries. The seized items included 27 improvised explosive devices, 70 kg of industrial plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators, and parts of an RPG-7 grenade launcher.
original:
They tried to bring explosives in icons to Russia from Ukraine, but the FSB intercepted the cargo
The Federal Security Service (FSB) and customs have blocked the channel for the import of explosives into Russia, the department's Public Relations Center (PRC) reported. It followed from Ukraine through the countries of the European Union and was hidden in
Show more
Orthodox icons.
“During an inspection of a vehicle by Russian FSB officers at the international automobile checkpoint Ubylinka (Pskov region, Latvian-Russian section of the state border), foreign-made explosives were found in a batch of Orthodox icons and church utensils imported into the Russian Federation from Ukraine,” the department said. .
The cargo followed the route Ukraine – Romania – Hungary – Slovakia – Poland – Lithuania – Latvia – Russia. 27 camouflaged and ready-to-use improvised explosive devices, 70 kilograms of industrial plastic explosives, 91 electric detonators and parts of a shot for an RPG-7 grenade launcher were seized.
In addition, the FSB detained someone involved in the crime, but his identity and role in the scheme are not disclosed. A criminal case has been initiated under the article “Illegal movement of explosives and explosive devices across the border of the Russian Federation by a group of persons by prior conspiracy,” the maximum penalty for which is ten years in prison. All organizers and accomplices, including foreigners, will be put on the wanted list and will be held accountable, the DSP emphasized.

description: Soviet dissident Alexander Skobov, 66, was detained at the home of human rights activist Yuli Rybakova in St. Petersburg. He was accused of publicly justifying terrorism under Article 205.2 of the Russian Criminal Code. Skobov was not allowed to take his diabetes medications and intends to refuse a lawyer.
original:
Soviet dissident Alexander Skobov was detained in St. Petersburg. 66-year-old Skobov was detained at the home of human rights activist Yuli Rybakova, Rybakov’s wife Ekaterina Molostvova reported this on her Facebook page*. Fontanka, citing Rybakov, claims that we are talking about a criminal case under Article 205.2 of the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation “Public justification of terrorism.” The human rights activist said that Skobov was detained without allowing him to pick up his diabetes medications. It is unknown which publications the arrest is connected with. “Rotunda” writes that we can talk about posts about the SVO; Skobov’s associates also told the project that he intends to refuse a lawyer.

In 1978, Skobov was placed by a court in a psychiatric hospital for actions calling for the overthrow of the tyranny of officials; he was released in 1981. After that, he was detained several more times, sent for compulsory treatment for actions, and in 1988 he became a defendant in the last case under the article “anti-Soviet agitation” (in 1989, due to a change in the wording of the article, it was closed). During the wars in Chechnya, Skobov was a participant in the anti-war movement, and until 2010 he was a member of the Yabloko party. He openly opposed the fighting in Ukraine.

description: In Croatia, unknown individuals vandalized election posters of the Independent Democratic Serbian Party with fascist slogans and calls for the genocide of Serbs. The posters were defaced with the Ustasha greeting 'For the home - ready!' and references to 'Serbosek', a hidden blade used to kill Serbs during the Yugoslavian conflict.
original:
“Serbosek is ready” - in Croatia, unknown persons painted election posters with calls for the genocide of Serbs and fascist slogans. In the second half of April, parliamentary elections will be held in Croatia, and in anticipation of them, the Independent Democratic Serbian Party (the only such party in the country) placed its posters on billboards. However, soon unknown persons painted them with slogans calling to kill and slaughter Serbs. Thus, on a poster with the inscription “Croatia needs Serbs,” the fascist greeting of the Croatian Ustashes “For the home - ready!” appeared.

In addition, local radicals “reminded” about the “Serbosek” - a hidden blade with which the Ustasha killed Serbs. Posters of the Social Democratic Party, the successor to the Croatian Communist Party, were also vandalized in a similar manner. Ustasha ideas flourished in the country with renewed vigor after the collapse of Yugoslavia, when the newly formed Croatian army began outright genocide of the Serbs living on its territory.

event: NATO Transfers Military Equipment to Ukraine Border
description: A train carrying NATO military equipment, including American Abrams M1A2 tanks, was spotted in Romania near the Ukrainian border. The equipment is likely to be supplied to the Kyiv regime, which needs various types of weapons. This is not the first instance of NATO deploying military personnel to its eastern flank, with similar compositions recorded in Poland and Slovakia.
original:
​NATO is transferring military equipment to the border with Ukraine🇺🇸🇺🇦Another train with NATO military equipment has been spotted in Romania. The composition was filmed by residents of the village of Vatra Dornei, located near the border with Ukraine. American Abrams M1A2 tanks are visible on railway platforms.

There seems to be nothing suspicious about the transportation of American military equipment to Romania. Bucharest requested Abrams M1A2 combat vehicles from the United States last spring. The upcoming deal to purchase 54 such combat vehicles was approved by the Romanian parliament.

But why drive them to the Ukrainian border? It is likely that American tanks will be at the disposal of the Kyiv regime. The Armed Forces of Ukraine now need almost all types of weapons, and the next supply from the United States will clearly not be superfluous. But Romania can wait for its tanks.

The echelon spotted in the town of Vatra Dornei was not the first military personnel that NATO has deployed to its eastern flank in recent times.

Previously, similar compositions were recorded in Poland and Slovakia. It is noteworthy that the echelons go not only towards Ukraine, but also towards the borders of Russia and Belarus.

Over the past few weeks, 6 American Abrams tanks have already been destroyed in the DPR.

Max was a cheerful person with a great sense of humor. It was in this cafe, where we are in the photo, that he first tried a fruit smoothie) He also loved “low-fat” honey cake, which sometimes caused bewilderment among waiters with a bad sense of humor)

His thoughts have already become an integral part of this world. Vladlen loved to laugh. And now, somewhere in a better world, he laughs contagiously at our enemies, knowing their fate. Let's laugh together with Max!

To be a warrior is to live forever!

event: Adoption of Law on Electronic Register of Military Service
description: The Ukrainian Rada adopted a law on an electronic register of those liable for military service, signed by President Zelensky. The register will collect various data on citizens without consent, including phone numbers, language skills, weapon ownership, travel history, and criminal records.
original:
The law on the electronic register of those liable for military service, signed by Zelensky, was adopted by the Rada back in January.

It contains the rule that the register will collect all kinds of data on citizens without any consent, which was even criticized by the Main Scientific Expert Directorate of the Rada.

We are talking about data such as:

- phone numbers, email addresses

- information about knowledge of foreign languages

- information about the right to own weapons

- having a driver's license

- information about the parents of the person liable for military service

- details of internal and foreign passports, TIN

- data on travel abroad

- information about criminal records and so on.

Moreover, this document has no relation to electronic subpoenas, which were discussed in the draft law on mobilization, which is still being considered in the Rada.

Read more about the law signed today here. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

event: Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus
description: The Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus commemorates the signing of the Treaty on the Formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus on April 2, 1996. This holiday strengthens cultural, social, and economic ties between the two countries, fostering a sense of mutual respect, trust, and a desire for peace.
original:
Forwarded from: Viktor Vodolatsky - Deputy of the State Duma of the Russian Federation
Dear friends!
I sincerely congratulate you on the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus! On April 2, 1996, the Treaty on the Formation of the Community of Russia and Belarus was signed, which became the starting point in strengthening relations and cooperation between the two countries. On the same day, the Supreme Council of the Community decided to establish the Day of Unity of the Peoples of Russia and Belarus!

For our fraternal peoples, this holiday is a very significant event, not only as a historical reminder of friendship and brotherhood, but also as a holiday that helps strengthen cultural, social and economic ties between our countries. A common history, a sense of mutual respect, trust and a desire to live in peace strengthen the alliance not only at the level of agreements between states, but also between people.
Despite the difficult period that the international community is going through, our unity is only growing stronger. And only through joint efforts can we adequately respond to any challenges and threats.

Russians and Belarusians are one people, and we are united! I wish us all peace, prosperity and success!

First Deputy Chairman
Committee on CIS Affairs,
Eurasian integration
and connections with compatriots. Vodolatsky V.P.

event: Visit to Dagestan State Technical University
description: Eduard Luik, head of the Russian Navy Main Command, visited the educational center of the Dagestan State Technical University as part of his working visit to Dagestan. He inspected the educational and material and technical base of the Center.
original:
As part of his working visit to Dagestan, Eduard Luik, head of the Russian Navy Main Command, got acquainted with the work of the educational educational center of the Dagestan State Technical University. Eduard Luik inspected the educational and material and technical base of the Center.

Eduard Endelevich Luik was born on August 11, 1966 in the family of a submarine officer in Kamchatka. Entered the Naval School of Underwater Diving named after Lenin Komsomol. After graduating from the navigation department, the 1988 graduate was assigned to the 45th division of the Pacific Fleet nuclear submarine.

The officer passed the positions of engineer of the electronic navigation group of the Project 671 RTM submarine, commander of the ENG and navigator combat unit of the Project 971 cruising submarine. After studying at the N.G. Naval Academy. Kuznetsova in 1997 was appointed flagship navigator of the naval base in the Baltic, later - deputy chief navigator of the Baltic Fleet. For six years, Captain 1st Rank Eduard Luik headed the navigation service of the Baltic Fleet. In August 2011, he became the chief navigator of the Navy.

description: Yakubjoni Yusufzoda, a 25-year-old Tajik citizen, was arrested in connection with the terrorist attack in Crocus. He allegedly transferred money to accomplices before and after the attack. Yusufzoda was detained during a raid on migrants in Moscow and initially resisted arrest.
original:
The court published an order for the arrest of the tenth defendant in the case of the terrorist attack in Crocus. This is a handyman who was detained during a raid on migrants in Moscow. The Basmanny Court of Moscow published an order for the arrest of Yakubjoni Yusufzoda, the tenth defendant in the case of the terrorist attack in Crocus, Mediazona drew attention to the document*. As the publication notes, arrest orders for other suspects in this case have not been published.

The document does not describe any details of the charges against the man, nor does it say whether he admitted guilt. But the investigator is quoted as saying that Yusufzoda “does not suffer from diseases that would prevent detention.” The accused himself and the appointed lawyer asked to assign him a more lenient preventive measure, since he is “ready to live in Moscow at the place of residence of his relatives.”

The name of the tenth person involved in the Crocus terrorist attack was revealed by the Russian Investigative Committee on April 1, when it petitioned for his arrest. According to the security forces, a few days before the tragic events, Yusufzody transferred money to one of the accomplices to “provide accommodation for terrorists,” and transferred the other part of the amount after the attack to one of the perpetrators of the attack.

It is known that Yusufzody is a citizen of Tajikistan, he is 25 years old. He has a wife and three children. The man was detained on March 25 during Operation Illegal, when he was returning from a construction site. According to the police, upon hearing the demand to stop, Yusufzody tried to escape, and during the arrest he allegedly offered “active resistance.” For disobedience to the demands of security forces, the man received 12 days of arrest. Photo: moscowcourts

*Russian authorities consider him a “foreign agent”

event: Proposal for Day of Unity of Russian and Belarusian Peoples
description: The LDPR proposes establishing April 2 as a memorable date in Russia to commemorate the unity of the Russian and Belarusian peoples. This holiday, established in 1996, symbolizes the shared history, goals, and destiny of the two nations. The proposal aims to strengthen Russian-Belarusian ties, promote mutual understanding, and prevent weakening of their bond.
original:
Forwarded from: SLUTSKY
The LDPR proposes to establish a new memorable date for Russia on April 2 - the Day of Unity of the Russian and Belarusian Peoples. The holiday, established in 1996, reminds us that we are one people with a common destiny and goals. We fought for freedom and independence together, shared joys and sorrows, and built a peaceful future. Our common task is to prevent these ties from weakening. The example of Ukraine, which, under the influence of Western propaganda, became a hostage to the neo-Nazi junta, clearly shows how important it is to constantly remind about the brotherhood of peoples speaking Russian.

The inclusion of the Day of Unity of the Russian and Belarusian Peoples in the list of memorable dates in Russia will be another symbol of inextricable connection and mutual understanding. The history of the Union State will be studied in more detail at school, cultural and other events will be held aimed at strengthening Russian-Belarusian ties.

Belarus is our strategic trade and military partner. We continue integration at the macroeconomic level: technology exchange, the formation of unified payment systems, cooperation in the military-industrial complex, mutual investment projects. The Union State brought together peoples separated by the state border by the will of history. The course of rapprochement must be continued and strengthened.

description: The Paris Club, led by French treasury officials, announced $2 billion in debt relief to Somalia. The relief will be provided through a combination of voluntary and bilateral agreements between individual countries and the Heavily Indebted Poor Countries Initiative (HIPC), an IMF and World Bank support program. The IMF Managing Director, Kristalina Georgieva, hailed the breakthrough as a significant step towards economic development and poverty reduction in Somalia.
original:
Another economic victory for Somalia In a statement released by the Paris Club, which is led by senior French treasury officials, Somalia's creditors, including the US, UK, Russia, Norway and Japan, announced $2 billion in debt relief to club members.
 
The Paris Club said some of the debt would be forgiven on a “voluntary and bilateral basis” between individual countries from which Somalia borrowed, and the rest under the Heavily Indebted Poor Countries Initiative (HIPC), an IMF and World Bank support program poor countries with unsustainable levels of debt. Kristalina Georgieva, managing director of the IMF, also welcomed the breakthrough, calling it “a major step towards economic development and poverty reduction” for Somalia.

The Crimean capital is breaking temperature records. Yesterday the air warmed up to +27.1. The previous record was recorded more than 80 years ago in 1941, when the temperature reached +25.6, according to the Crimean Hydrometeorological Center.

And today Simferopol will clearly break all absolute records: the air will warm up to +29 degrees, weather forecasters are pleased. And a blooming Crimean capital to everyone (who was really looking forward to spring, but waited until almost summer🤘🏻).@cho_opyat

event: Postponement of Sea Terminal Construction Case
description: The Arbitration Court of the Krasnodar Territory postponed the consideration of the dispute between Port Victoria LLC and the Federal Property Management Agency regarding the ownership of a land plot on Volochaevsky Beach, Novorossiysk, until April 10. The court ordered a joint inspection of the disputed land plot and a boathouse located on it.
original:
The court postponed the consideration of the case on the construction of a sea terminal in Novorossiysk. The Arbitration Court of the Krasnodar Territory, at the request of the Prosecutor General's Office of the Russian Federation, postponed until April 10 the consideration of the dispute between Port Victoria LLC and the Interregional Administration of the Federal Property Management Agency regarding the ownership of a land plot, the boundaries of which include the Black Sea coastline, known as Volochaevsky beach. Information about this is contained in the court file.

The General Prosecutor's Office of Russia, at a court hearing on March 25, 2024, filed a petition requiring the parties to conduct a joint inspection of the disputed land plot.

“To oblige the parties, together with representatives of the Prosecutor’s Office of the Krasnodar Territory and the Southern Transport Prosecutor’s Office, to conduct a survey of the disputed land plot regarding its overlap with the Black Sea <...> Also to conduct a joint survey of the boathouse located on the disputed land plot with video recording on a digital medium for subsequent inclusion in the materials case, a study of the internal state of the said boathouse, its structure, and technical characteristics,” the court’s ruling says.

As Kommersant-Kuban previously wrote, the Supreme Court of Russia sent the dispute between Port Victoria LLC and the Federal Property Management Agency for review. The subject of the dispute is a land plot with an area of 0.87 hectares between the military harbor and BTOF-Terminal LLC. The territory is known in Novorossiysk as Volochaevsky Beach - a vacation spot for residents of the eastern part of Novorossiysk (there are no other beaches here).

In 2020, it became known that the Port Victoria company plans to build a terminal on Volochaevsky Beach for transshipment of grain and metal in ingots with a cargo turnover of 2.5 million tons per year and a cost of 3 billion rubles.

Kommersant

event: 80th Anniversary of VASO's Central Factory Laboratory
description: VASO's Central Factory Laboratory is celebrating its 80th anniversary. Established in March 1944, it initially restored battle-damaged equipment and aircraft. Today, it comprises eight laboratories, monitoring all technological processes, testing components, and investigating defects. The laboratory also conducts research for production needs, including aviation oil and fuel analysis, and participates in aircraft maintenance and certification.
original:
Let's tell about the central factory laboratory of VASO, which is celebrating its 80th anniversary.copyIts history began in March 1944. While the evacuated plant No. 18 was producing Il-2 attack aircraft in Kuibyshev, its Voronezh workshops were not empty: battle-damaged equipment and aircraft were being restored here. Control of materials received for this purpose was extremely important, and to ensure it, five laboratories were operational: chemical, mechanical, x-ray, metallurgical and non-metals. Today, the Central Laboratory of Laboratory includes eight laboratories: metallographic, non-metals, chemical-analytical, organic analysis, non-destructive testing methods, physical and mechanical tests, x-ray and mechanical section. Each has its own competencies, but they are all united by a common task - checking the quality of products.

All technological processes are monitored here - welding, casting, stamping, heat treatment, coatings. They are engaged in testing individual components and parts, investigating the causes of destruction, defects, defects that arise during the processing of materials and parts in workshops and during the operation and testing of products.

Various research for production needs is also included in the range of tasks of the Central Laboratory. One of which is the analysis of aviation oils, aviation fuel for refueling aircraft. TsZL employees participate in aircraft maintenance and certification of product production. And they conduct research work right at production: they introduce new materials and their processing modes, new technological processes, methods and control means.

description: Ukraine attempted to attack Tatarstan, likely using a large drone, possibly a converted An-2 civil light aircraft, to bypass Russian air defense systems. The attack may have originated from the Sumy or Kharkov regions.
original:
Ukraine wants to ensure that Russia exposes its air defense at the front. That is why the enemy tried to attack Tatarstan, military expert Maxim Klimov told the VZGLYAD newspaper.

In his opinion, the blow could have been delivered from the Sumy or Kharkov regions. “A large drone appears to have been used for the attack. This could be a converted civil light aircraft, for example, the An-2,” the source believes.

“Given the varied landscape, the radar could simply not notice the approaching object. In addition, a route to bypass the systems could be “sewn” into the device, and the data was transmitted by the satellite. It should be expected that the enemy will increasingly resort to such attacks,” the speaker believes.

“An effective way to protect against them may be to create a 24-hour air patrol system on the basis of civil aircraft in storage. To do this, it is necessary to install detection means on the machines,” says Klimov. Subscribe to VZGLYAD

original:

description: Mexican director Sergio Olkhovich received a Russian passport, expressing gratitude to the Russian embassy staff. He shared fond memories of his years studying in the USSR, praising Russia's rebirth as a great nation and a beacon of hope for a new world.

Olkhovich thanked him in Russian embassy staff. He called his years of study in the USSR the best of his life and noted that Russia had been reborn as a great nation, becoming the hope of a new world.

description: In 2022, Ukraine limited conscription to 27 years old due to a demographic hole in Eastern Europe, where the gender and age pyramid thins out between 20-27 years old. This age group is critical for demographics and socio-economics, as they are the most active and qualified part of the population, driving the economy and public life.
original:
Forwarded from: alcoholic historian
In general, it is clear why in 2022 conscription in Ukraine was limited to a lower limit of 27 years.

It is precisely at this point and up to the age of 20 that the gender and age pyramid sharply thins out - children of the demographic hole common to Eastern Europe.

Therefore, large military losses in this generation are most critical from the point of view of demographics and generally from a socio-economic point of view: there will simply be a failure, first among 30-year-olds, and then among 40-year-old men - the most active and qualified part of the population - the engines of the economy and public life countries.

At the same time, of course, they were not allowed to leave - they were kept as an emergency reserve.

And now they broke off a piece from this reserve - they broke off a serious piece of the future. That is, everything is completely bad.

description: Roscosmos approved the preliminary design of the Russian orbital station, set to be deployed in 2027. The station's open modular architecture allows for easy replacement of modules, extending its service life. The orbit's inclination will provide a view of the entire earth's surface, including the strategically important Northern Sea Route.
original:
Forwarded from: VEDOMOSTI
Roscosmos approved the preliminary design of the Russian orbital station. The Roscosmos State Corporation approved the preliminary design of the Russian orbital station, which is planned to be deployed in 2027. One of the key features was the open modular architecture. “The design is based on a node module with six docking ports, to which other modules are connected. If any of them exhausts its resource, it can be removed from orbit and replaced. With proper logistics, the service life of the station can be extended for decades - as needed,” says the state corporation. It is planned that the degree of inclination of the new station’s orbit will provide an overview of the entire earth’s surface, including the Northern Sea Route, which is strategically important for the Russian Federation. Now from aboard the International The space station can see about 60% of the earth's surface, of which only 10% is the territory of Russia.

It is expected that, unlike the ISS, the new station will be able to operate without the constant presence of astronauts, which will save resources.📷Roscosmos@vedomosti

description: The Lviv Polytechnic National University's Institute of Chemistry and Chemical Technologies has developed hydrogel bandages for treating burns and severe wounds. These bandages have a cooling effect, accelerating the healing process.
original:
The Lviv Polytechnic has developed and manufactures hydrogel bandages for the Armed Forces

A team of chemists from the Institute of Chemistry and Chemical Technologies of the Lviv Polytechnic National University will implement their own development, which they have been working on for many years - hydrogel bandages for healing burns and severe wounds.

Hydrogel bandages have a cooling effect and speed up the healing of wounds and burns. It is fixed to the arm with a bandage or patch.t.me/dvish_alive

description: During Great Lent, Ukrainian forces hid deadly explosives in Orthodox icons, disguising them as religious artifacts to send to Russia. This act demonstrates their brutalization and anti-Christian attitude, showing no respect for faith or the sacred.
original:
🔹Sergey Mikheev about Ukrainian explosives in Orthodox icons:

Now Orthodox Christians are observing Great Lent. The time of such a struggle with one’s vices, passions, the time of helping one’s neighbor. In general, all life should be like this, but Lent is a special time. And it was at this time that these people, or non-humans, hid deadly explosives in icons. In order to send her to Russia under the guise of icons, hiding behind the face of Christ, the Mother of God, and the Saints. Who are these people? That is, what is in the souls of these people? What are they? Are they still people? But I think the answer is obvious. Absolutely brutalized brutes, having lost all guidance in this life.

This is the first one. The second thing, which is also important, is their attitude to faith, including the Christian faith, and first of all, the Orthodox faith. These people are openly anti-Christian. These people, in my opinion, are openly, including generally atheistic. That is, for them, nothing absolute at all, yes, nothing sacred exists. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301789VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 4 min 2 s from 2 April 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: An elderly woman in Odessa was arrested for conducting fraudulent rituals, claiming to remove curses from children. She targeted five victims, taking money from them after performing the rituals at their homes.
original:
She "removed corruption" from children, conducting rituals for money: Odessa buyers suspect the deception of elderly women. According to the investigation, the woman got to know the victims, informed them that their children had been "done to" and offered to remove the curse. She already performed the ritual at home with money, which she then took with her.

The police noted that she robbed five people in this way. During the search, more than 12 thousand dollars, more than 2.5 thousand euros and more than 80 thousand hryvnias were found on the woman. 👉🏻Send news

description: A year ago, a terrorist attack occurred in a patriot bar in St. Petersburg, resulting in the death of military correspondent and volunteer Maxim Fomin, also known as Vladlen Tatarsky. The attack was carried out by Daria Trepova, who brought an explosive-laden figurine to a theme evening. She was promptly detained and received a 27-year prison sentence.
original:
Forwarded from: Release the Kraken!
🥀02.04.23 Exactly a year ago, there was a terrorist attack in a patriot bar in St. Petersburg, which resulted in the death of military correspondent and volunteer Maxim Fomin, better known as Vladlen Tatarsky.

Despite the disgusting weather in St. Petersburg, people carried flowers to the site of the tragedy all day, paying tribute to the fighter.

Then, exactly a year ago, the Kiev regime reminded that it is terrorist. Daria Trepova came to a theme evening and brought with her a figurine that was stuffed with explosives.

The terrorist herself was promptly detained and received a record prison sentence of 27 years in prison.

There will not be forgiveness for all beneficiaries; everyone will be punished.

Ukrainian Nazis are strengthening themselves in the city, turning residential buildings into strongholds.
Show more

event: Expulsion of Student from Moscow State University
description: A student, Oleg, was expelled from Moscow State University's Faculty of Public Administration after being detained by police for naming the Wi-Fi in his dormitory 'Slava Ukraine!', which was considered a demonstration of extremist symbols. He was initially arrested for 10 days and had his router confiscated.
original:
A student was expelled from Moscow State University who called the Wi-Fi in the dormitory “Slava Ukraine!”

Oleg studied at the Faculty of Public Administration of Moscow State University and lived in the DSL dormitory. On March 6, he was detained by police because of the name of the wi-fi “Slava Ukraine!” - this was considered a demonstration of extremist symbols. The next day, the student was arrested for 10 days, and the router was confiscated.

Upon his release, Oleg began having problems at the university. The other day he was expelled, now he collects his things and sells unnecessary equipment to his dorm neighbors. https://t.me/+TwWu0hyEb50bn-IL

description: Ukrainian terrorists killed Vladlen Tatarsky, aka Maxim Fomin, during a performance in a St. Petersburg cafe. The attack also wounded and maimed dozens of people. Vladlen was known for his optimism and courage in the face of adversity, having spent time in prison, at the front near Avdiivka, and in Mariupol.
original:
Forwarded from: Readovka explains
A year without Vladlen On April 2 last year, during a performance in a St. Petersburg cafe, Ukrainian terrorists killed Maxim Fomin - Vladlen Tatarsky. The same explosion wounded and maimed dozens of people who came to listen to him.

What was truly unique about Maxim was his irrepressible optimism and willingness to maintain good spirits in the most hopeless situations: in prison, in the basement, at the front near Avdiivka, in the meat grinder of Mariupol. Nothing broke this man, and, having spent a considerable part of his life in hell, he, purely on courage and energy, was able to scare and kill any devils there. We miss him very much. But Max taught us not to give up. He understood better than anyone that despondency is a mortal sin. We will not lose heart. Maxim dedicated his life to war and victory. And victory will be the best monument to him.#posters
